com.martensigwart.fakeload

Interface SimulationInfrastructure

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultSimulationInfrastructure

    public interface SimulationInfrastructure
    Represents a simulation infrastructure in which system load as specified by FakeLoad objects is simulated.

    A simulation infrastructure is built up of different tasks. Each task serves a specific simulation purpose. There should be tasks responsible for CPU load simulation, for memory simulation, etc. A SimulationInfrastructure provides functionality for adjusting system loads via increase and decrease methods.

    Class DefaultSimulationInfrastructure provides a default implementation of an infrastructure.

    Since:
    1.8
    Author:
    Marten Sigwart
    See Also:
    DefaultSimulationInfrastructure, FakeLoad

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void decreaseSystemLoadBy(FakeLoad load)
      Decreases the system load simulated by the simulation infrastructure by the specified FakeLoad
      void increaseSystemLoadBy(FakeLoad load)
      Increases the system load simulated by the simulation infrastructure by the specified FakeLoad instance

    • Method Detail

      • increaseSystemLoadBy

        void increaseSystemLoadBy(FakeLoad load)
                   throws MaximumLoadExceededException
        Increases the system load simulated by the simulation infrastructure by the specified FakeLoad instance
        Parameters:
        load - the load by which the overall system load is increased
        Throws:
        MaximumLoadExceededException - in case the specified increase of the system load would exceed the allowed maximum load of the system

      • decreaseSystemLoadBy

        void decreaseSystemLoadBy(FakeLoad load)
        Decreases the system load simulated by the simulation infrastructure by the specified FakeLoad
        Parameters:
        load - the load by which the overall system load is decreased
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - in case the specified decrease would cause an illegal (e.g. negative) system load
